page.title: 02Abinger Hammer & Gomshall 2
page.content:
As the A25 has been one of the main routes east-west across SE England, the villages along this road have had to put up with heavy traffic both commercial and private. The narrow road at this point and the resultant safety aspects have been of concern to the villagers. The opening of the southern stretches of the M25 have, however, helped to alleviate the situation by diverting much of the traffic, particularly the lorries and juggernauts.
The Tonbridge-Reading railway line also runs along the edge of the Downs. The only station in the block is at Gomshall.
A bus service from Dorking to Guildford runs through the villages.
